text:
> I'm surprised they borrowed so much from functional langs, but there's not even a nod toward static typing. Odd.
I reckon the extent of LiveScript's ambition is "add syntactic sugar on top of JavaScript to make it more amenable to functional programming". (CoffeeScript, but more so!). So it doesn't surprise me that it lacks types, or immutable data structures, or lazy evaluation, or etc.

elements.text: I'm surprised they borrowed so much from functional langs, but there's not even a nod toward static typing. Odd.
